intro: Tabernaemontana duckei, commonly known as the Madagascar star flower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has smooth, glabrous stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers emit a subtle fragrance and bloom during the rainy season.
